> FWIW=

 "close" and overhead-free(ish).

with a few clicks/key-
presses

Hi Aviv,

Thanks for your comments. We are working on trying to red=
uce the 
overheads for the JUnit tester as much as possible, as well as 
pr=
ovide an ANT task to run our tool, so people can tie it in with 
their ANT =
builds.  

I appreciate that purely for ad-hoc execution, then it can easil=
y be 
done via an IDE or the shell prompt, in which case this could be an 
=
over engineered solution - so I can see your point of view. But as 
well as=
 execution, we're aiming to provide something that will 
schedule automated=
 test runs and provide historical results for 
their test suites and each c=
ase executed etc.

Cheers,
Les.
